result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
02:36 PM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. DE appears in custody with Atty Terry Rose and ASL interpreters Katherine Block and Sara Voelker - sworn.   Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:  Parties prepared to proceed. Dr. Jenna Goebel sworn and testifies. Dr. opines DE is not currently competent to proceed, but is likely to regain competency within the statutory time period. Court accepts Dr's report and incorporates it into the record. DE is found not competent but likely to regain. Case suspended, and remediation is ordered. Review to be scheduled upon receipt of Dr's status report.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Terry Rose.  ASL interpreters - Kate Block & Sara Voelker.  Report has been received which opines the deft is not competent at this time.  Court attempts to colliquey with deft; interrupted to allow Atty Terry Rose to speak with the deft.  Court reconvenes.  Atty Rose requests competency hrg.  CH set for 5/10/22 @ 2:30pm.  Dtr may testify via Zoom.  Both ASL interpreters are available.
along with Cover Sheet for Confidential Records - rcv'd from WI Forensic Unit
WCS and DHS/MMHI notified of order for exam via email; certified copy sent to jail.  kmk
by DHS
Competency hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ASL interpreters not available on 4/5 @ 11:45am; CH set over to 4/7/22 @ 10am
for comp exam
rcv'd from Robert Z., Sr.

Defendant Robert J. Klentz appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose with ASL/Lip Interpreter Kate Block and captioning Interpreter Sarah Voelker.  Defendant in custody. Attorney James Steven Kraus appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  State has filed amended complaint and bond motion.  Both are acknowleged.  Bond motion will not be heard today.  Atty Rose raises issue of competency.  Court orders comp exam.  Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 11:45 am.
rcv'd from Atty. Terry Rose requesting comp exam.  kmk
to Modify Bond - filed by ADA, Alexander Huber  kmk

Adjustment Number: 22A 119506,
Payable Number: 337343,
Receipt Number: 22R 005139,
Amount: $20.00
Interpreting agency is not available on 03-21-21.   STC is going to be changed to a PH on 03-18-22 at 8:30am Intake.  DA notified.

Defendant Robert J. Klentz in court, in custody with hearing assistance interpreter Kate Block .  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Per interpreter Kate; DE does not understand ASL but was able to lip read today.    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing due to SPD needing additional verification. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  DE gives permission on the record for SPD to speak with his sister; SPD notified.   For next hearing interpreter Kate suggested both an interpreter for lip reading and a real time captioning interpreter so DE can see if reading will be easier for him to understand.  Date for the next hearing may change if interpreters are not available; DE advised on the record this may occur and he will be notified of any change.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Review scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 07:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  MEA ; Jose A; Samantha A; Catherine E; Juan E; Patricia G-V; Janet T; Samuel T; and NO CONTACT with any minor children except for incidental.  No internet usage for any illegal activites or for pornography.  No pronagraphy,  No sex toys.

243PM    State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brian Rolf.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.  $100,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  DE hard of hearing but would prefer no ASL interpreter because he didn't use sign language for years.   ts
and witness list filed by the State
